column90:
the ‘spill over’ and
‘reverse spill over’ of CSFV infections among wild and
domestic population in endemic areas; CSF infection is endemic in wild hog in Assam, India and might act as a viral
reservoir that poses a constant threat to domestic pigs; backyard pig farming, highly mobile
pigs and their products through live animal markets are
main contributing factors in the endemic nature of CSF
in India.

column90:
The virus is widespread in Brazil with a seroprevalence higher than
50% in several regions in domestic species. The co-circulation of various BTV strains within the same animal population enhances the possibility of viral reassortment and occurrence of novel serotypes with unknown phenotypic and pathogenic characteristics.
column94:
five BTV serotypes (3, 14, 18, 19, and 22) were identified. These BTV serotypes had not been previously
described or isolated in Brazil, either in wild or domestic ruminants

column90:
rabid wild fox entered the pastoralist
village and bit a domestic dog. The victim dog had turned rabid
after four months and bit livestock, and rabies outbreak occurred
in the family livestock —— does this one count?       (introduced/invasive species: fox)
column94:
In September 2015, rabid wild fox entered the pastoralist
village and bit a domestic dog. The victim dog had turned rabid
after four months and bit livestock, and rabies outbreak occurred
in the family livestock. Consequently, one bull, one lactating cow,
one calf, two donkeys and one heifer died of outbreak; After five months, one
heifer and a donkey from a neighbor became rabid
and died after a week of clinical signs.
column95:
in cattle: excessive salivation, behavioral
change, yawning, abnormal bellowing, pica in one
case (biting wooden material), a lactating cow
refused calf to suckle. In donkey: aggressiveness,
kicking, attempt to bite other animals, biting its
own body (one case) to the level of inflicting
itself.

Minks were fed a ration prepared in large batches at the same location, referred to as a kitchen. The ration was composed of
uncooked meat by-products of swine, beef, and poultry obtained from slaughterhouse facilities. The swine by-product
included ground lung purchased in large frozen blocks from areas of the country where swine influenza H3N2 is known to be prevalent.     Food contamination vs provisioning: feeding of animals with a ration composed of uncooked meat by-products of swine obtained from slaughterhouse facilities originated from swine H1N1 epidemic region?
